intro: Pamplethantha verticillata, commonly known as the spiral leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
